paragraphs.text: President Obama, here's how you build a legacy.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Two years from now, the country will be on the verge of inaugurating the 45th president of the United States
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The presidency of Barack Obama will be over
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to the joy and relief of many Americans, there will be a new beginning
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To quote President Obama's 2008 campaign slogan "Hope and Change" will be the order of the day
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Certainly "change" will come with the new occupant of 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The certainty of who that man or woman will be two years from now is unknown
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It will depend on who can survive the already begun long campaign
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: that will easily be the most expensive in history
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Immediately after the oath of Office is taken at noon on January 20th, 2017 on the West Portal of the Capitol, the pictures on the walls of the White House and the personal artifacts of Barack Obama and his family will be removed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The legacy left behind and the permanent White House staff will stay on awaiting the new leader of the free world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Hope" is always in the minds of Americans along with good will for any new president
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Much of that good will and almost all of the "hope," that this president could or would be different, is gone
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: With a little more than half of the president's second term remaining, judgments have been made
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: speculation is rampant that the White House decisions are now being made is to define that legacy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: His expected veto decision on the Keystone pipeline is to appease the environmentalists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: His executive orders allowing millions of illegals to stay in the country rather than be deported is also viewed as a pandering to the fastest growing voting group
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: His alteration by executive order creating changes in his health care law have enraged members of Congress that have the real power to change laws
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: His attempt to close Guantanamo prison over the objections of Congress is another critical debate
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But the biggest and most long lasting mistake maybe his withdrawal of ground troops from both Iraq and Afghanistan
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And one he has not yet made may be more severe and dangerous to world peace -- his headlong rush toward an attempt to get a nuclear deal with Iran
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A deal that, in spite of all the reassurances from Secretary of State John Kerry, will enable Iran to make nuclear weapons
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The mainstream media is feeding into this legacy debate
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: One of the latest examples, The New York magazine cover story of January 11, called the "Obama History Project."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The magazine asked 53 historians to weigh in on Barack Obama's legacy and how they think he will be measured 20 years from now
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Historians play a vital role in measuring presidents
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Usually their histories are written decades after the fact
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they can go back and review documents and gather facts and see the results of presidential actions from afar and in a cold dissected view
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Historians have certainly altered the view of many former presidents and have actually restored the reputations of a few
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Harry Truman being a perfect example
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A man greatly respected today
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Truman left office with a tattered reputation, was very unpopular with the public, and could not possibly been reelected
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: when he left office in 1952
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Today, he is ranked among the top 10 presidents by most presidential scholars
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: A review of Eisenhower is going on now
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: his marks are high
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Lyndon Johnson and George Herbert Walker Bush are getting favorable reviews by the historians after being out of office for decades
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I am a partisan Republican
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: who has worked in the administrations of three presidents and served two tours of duty at the highest level of Ronald Reagan's White House
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As an American and as the father of a young college-aged daughter, I don't want any president to fail
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I want this country to be led by the very best people we can find
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It isn't always so
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Every president, or people on his staff are looking out for his legacy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But the boss I worked for, President Reagan, operated under a different theory
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: One day we were returning from a trip out somewhere in the country
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: We were flying aboard Marine One, the presidential helicopter, across Washington, after leaving Air Force One at Andrews Air Base
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The president was very tired
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as we landed on the South Lawn, he looked up at pictures of his ranch displayed on the walls of the chopper
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He said, pointing to the ranch pictures,"I wish we were landing there!"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Not knowing what to say to the leader of the free world who obviously didn't want to go back to work
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I said,"Mr  President, it will all be worthwhile. History will be very kind to you someday."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He chuckled and said right back."Ed, I don't care about history. I am going to be dead and gone and they will distort it anyways. What I care about is those great young people we saw out there today and making sure they have the same opportunities we all had."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He turned to his closest friend, also sitting there, Senator Paul Laxalt (R.-Nev
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He said Paul's father was a Basque immigrant sheepherder and his mother a hotel cook
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He turned to me and said:"Your dad was shipyard worker and my own father was a travelling shoe salesman. We are all here because this great country gave us opportunities. We have to make sure that's what we leave behind and those kids out there get those same opportunities. Now let's get back in there and go to work!"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Ronald Reagan loved this country and was proud to be the leader of the greatest group of people in the world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: President Obama, that's how you build a legacy!
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: President Obama's life story is one of inspiration
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To come from a broken home, abandoned by his father as an infant, to be raised by grandparents from the Midwest and to achieve, as a black man, the highest office in the land is inspirational
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Unfortunately, he has not been an inspirational president
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mr  Obama, let me speak to you directly
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Right now your legacy is that your party suffered historic losses across the country at every level in 2014
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Your health care plan will cost enormous sums above your estimates
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and even those who didn't have health insurance and now do, can't get health care
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Dodd-Frank bill has cost American business billions of dollars
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: thousands of lawyers are working around the clock to deal with the implementation of it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You pulled our troops out of Iraq and Afghanistan before the job was done
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And your lack of strength as a leader has made the strongest nation in the world look weak and vulnerable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You have the greatest political tin ear I've ever seen in a president
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Someone should have told you to take your place at the front of the line with other world leaders in Sunday's million person march in Paris, against worldwide terrorism
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Or you should have known yourself
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Yes
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Mr  President, they are terrorists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they hate everything we stand for
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You want a legacy?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Work with the Congress the American people chose and get something done!
paragraphs.label: assumption
